metadata.title: CVE-2019-8675 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. Thisissue is fixed in macOS Mojave 10.14.6, Security Update 2019-004 HighSierra, Security Update 2019-004 Sierra. An attacker in a privilegednetwork position may be able to execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
cups-bsd - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
cups-client - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
cups-common - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
cups-core-drivers - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
cups-daemon - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
cups-ipp-utils - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
cups-ppdc - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
cups-server-common - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
libcups2 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
libcupscgi1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
libcupsimage2 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
libcupsmime1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
libcupsppdc1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.3-4ubuntu0.10').
